text: I don’t ask for them but I do provide them. We give bonuses for work completed ahead of schedule and whether or not everything adhered to our checklist.

elements.text: I don’t ask for them but I do provide them. We give bonuses for work completed ahead of schedule and whether or not everything adhered to our checklist.

text:
Hey <@U0136JJHUSK>,

I was in a similar situation once.

I think the following matter before signing up for an agreement like this:

- Who you're reporting to - their expertise in evaluating your work. This is one of the things where I experienced  dissatisfaction.

- It'll be worthwhile to have them share with you how they'll measure the performance upfront - before you start work, so you have a chance to decide whether you want to sign up for them

- How often will the bonus be paid, because results like conversions take time to show. This is the other thing I got my hands burned with.

- Feedback meetings will be essential so that you get a chance to improve and work towards getting that bonus. I'd recommend discussing this as well.

In addition to this, I'd like to share my opinion on this model as well. Apologies if this is of no value to you. But I'll take the chance. My experience with such a payment model made me question what the incentive of the client is to give me the bonus. In case of full-time work, companies try to be fair to manage employee motivation, and manage retention. Which often may not be the case when we work as freelancers.

text: <@U02AUQ0KMGC> I really value your perspective on this, and your honesty! Thank you so much for helping me think this through. Im going to re-jig my pitch based on your comments. I appreciate it!

elements.text: I really value your perspective on this, and your honesty! Thank you so much for helping me think this through. Im going to re-jig my pitch based on your comments. I appreciate it!

text: <@U02AUQ0KMGC> very good point. More often than not, clients would want to use this to safeguard themselves. But I am keen to listen to success stories with this model.

elements.text: very good point. More often than not, clients would want to use this to safeguard themselves. But I am keen to listen to success stories with this model.

text:
Agree with <@U02AUQ0KMGC> to try and determine if their incentivized to pay the performance bonus, and making sure your ability to hit the bonus threshold is mostly within your control, not theirs (if possible). 

Not sure what your specific situation is, but if they told you they are commissioning content primarily for email newsletters but set a bonus based on how well they perform on social as well, there are competing incentives influencing how you’d tackle the project.
